column4: I installed ubuntu-studio audio package, but would like to have the extended version of one of the softwares, that is Pure Data. But if I try removing it with synaptic I get a message that all the ubuntu-studio chould be also removed. That seems quit illogical. What am I missing?
ubuntu-studio is a metapackage, it will not remove all the parts of ubuntu-studio
its a package that depends on a whole bunch of different packages, so it installs a certain set of software
well, since a metapackge depends on a program being installed, when you uninstall that program, the metapackge must be removed also
